_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:02:36 using v2.0
title: How does health expenditure per head vary by country?
analysis_commentary: The United States outspends all other countries, spending $5,103 more than the UK and $5,186 more than the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) average. The UK is just above the average, in 2011, spending $3,405 compared to the average of $3,322.
data_source: Office for National Statistics, Health Data 2013
